sn23.9:1.2: When Venerable Rādha was seated to one side, the Buddha said to him:
sn23.9:1.3: “Rādha, you should give up any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for form.
sn23.9:1.4: Thus that form will be given up, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.
sn23.9:1.5: You should give up any desire, greed, relishing, and craving for feeling …
sn23.9:1.11: Thus that consciousness will be given up, cut off at the root, made like a palm stump, obliterated, and unable to arise in the future.”
